sen.j: 頭塔（ずとう）は、奈良市高畑町にある土製の塔。
sen.e: Zuto is the earthen tower in Takabatake-cho, Nara-city.

sen.j: 1辺30m、高さ10m、7段の階段ピラミッド状の構造をしている。
sen.e: It has a 7 step-stairway pyramid structure of 30 meters on one side, 10 meters high.

sen.e: On the other hand, there is a tradition that it was Genbo's Kubi-zuka (burial mound for heads) since "Shichidaiji Junrei Shiki" (Private Journal of a Pilgrimage to the Seven Great Temples).

sen.j: 「どとう」が転訛して「ずとう」と称されるようになり、玄昉首塚説との関連で、「頭塔」という漢字が当てられたものと考えられる。
sen.e: The sound of 'doto' changed to 'zuto' and with a relation of the theory of Genbo's Kubi-zuka, Chinese character '頭塔' (head tower) is thought to have been applied.

sen.e: Thirteen stone Buddhist images of the ones on each step were designated as Important Cultural Property in 1977, and additionally nine ones, which were discovered in the later excavation, were designated as such.
